etymologies: early 20th century: from French, literally ‘boathook’ (from Provençal gaf: see gaff), used colloquially to mean ‘blunder’

definitions: an unintentional act or remark causing embarrassment to its originator; a blunder

examples.text: in my first few months at work I made some real gaffes
his comments are a major diplomatic gaffe

shortDefinitions: unintentional act or remark causing embarrassment to its originator
